page.title: 04WELSHPOOL-A TOURIST CENTRE
page.content: {The Powysland Museum,}situated near the church, was given to the town by the Powysland Club in 1884. Today it houses mainly exhibits from the local area dating back to pre-history. The museum frequently puts on exhibitions of life at certain periods in recent history eg.the 1950s. { {The Montgomery Canal}runs through the centre of Welshpool and was once part of the national network. Built at the turn of the eighteenth century to carry lime,coal,timber and cloth it fell into disrepair in the 1930's. By today it has been partially restored and boat trips are running on several stretches,including the one in town. There are plans to continue the restoration and complete the link with the Llangollen Canal at Welsh Frankton.
